title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Müres [Mulberries], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Desert Service], 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Müres [Mulberries], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Desert Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue-gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and blue ink on mount, lower center:  Les Müres
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Enclosed yard of a farmhouse.  At right, a woman holding a basket of berries in her right hand points with her left hand to a mulberry bush.  In center, three children sit on the ground  eating berries under the watchful eye of a an elder woman.  Behind them to the left, a man balances a tray of berry containers on his head.  In the left foreground, a seated woman appears to be sifting sugar into a vessel, while a small child leans on her shoulder. In the distance is a grove of trees.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Müres [Mulberries], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Desert Service], 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue-gray paper. 
1989-13-12
